name: Morph (My Open-source Reconfigurable Platform Hub)
body:
### Welcome to the Morph Community.
Ok lets get started.
If you are a hardware developer you will need to download Eagle Cad if you don't already have it. 
And if you are a software developer you will need to download Code Composure Studio (CSS) from Texas Instruments. 

Once you have download the appropriate software the next step is to clone the repository:

```
$ cd your_local_directory/your_repo_name
$ git clone https://github.com/researcher111/reconPlat.git
```

### Hardware Designers
Once you have cloned the repo. You can navigate to the folder called "hardware" which has the collection of hardware files that you will to open in eagle. 

### Software developers
Once you have clone the repo the is a Code Composure Studio project in the software folder. If you open this project it will open up the Code Composure Studio with the right environmental configurations. 

### Platform Schematics
The figure below shows a copy of the platforms schematics. 
![Hardware layout](https://raw.githubusercontent.com/researcher111/reconPlat/master/Hardware-Layout-Files/Layout.png)
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
